job_title: Operations in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Excellent leaders, people and facility
cons: Large Corporation, slow to adapt sometimes

job_title: Registered Nurse in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Co workers/culture, supportive environment, amazing managers/charge nurses, the oncology patients are always amazing to care for, overall great benefits
cons: work life balance, always short handed, non competitive pay (I'm making $10 more an hour doing outpatient than when I was working here), staff turnover

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Lone Tree, CO
pros: nothing really good about it when working nights
cons: as a newbie you are just thrown in

job_title: RN Operating Room in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Great staff team who cares about you and ensures that you get your breaks, work with some great surgeons, all coworkers are supportive and work together as a cohesive unit. Great place to work for a max of 1-2 years.
cons: Honestly if HCA would increase pay to market levels to match cost of living instead of considering Colorado as a destination location to live then it would create more longevity. Benefits are not great either. It’s a great starting point with HCA, but there’s no longevity offered through pay… and very likely won’t be any changes for years to come. After getting experience it makes most sense to change locations, either hospital, out of state, or turn to traveling to get the pay you deserve for how hard you work. Currently you are frequently asked to stay late, or work on your day off (for good bonuses considering the low pay, but let’s be honest, you should already be making hourly what you make in a bonus)

job_title: Nurse Extern in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Flexibility, good team management,wonderful patient’s population,
cons: Understaffed, often assigned too many patients what makes it hard to deliver above and beyond care.

job_title: Registered Nurse
pros: The staff is the best part about working here.
cons: Meditech, ratios, non-competitive pay, doctor-to-nurse interactions

job_title: Patient Care Technician/Float Pool in Lone Tree, CO
pros:
Loved the workplace culture. Almost everyone is a delight to work with. I felt valued and appreciated daily. I learned a lot during my time and got to work all over the hospital. Great place to be for a year or two before going to nursing/PA/medical school.

The pay was relatively high (for a CNA position) to boot!
cons:
Sitting for patients could get physically and emotionally rough. You will still have to take care of yourself. 
Teams were chronically short staffed while I was there.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician I (MLT) in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Leadership is helpful and responsive
cons: Manning is low, but is low everywhere

job_title: OR Coordinator in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Growth. Teamwork. Great pay. Tuition reimbursement
cons: Far drive from home. Especially in the snow

job_title: RN, MSN in Littleton, CO

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Lone Tree, CO

review_title: Great people but management doesn't care.

review_title: Company does not care about being the highest paying

review_title: Not sure I'll work here again.

job_title: Registrar in Denver, CO

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Lone Tree, CO

job_title: Medical Intern (PGY1), Internal Medicine in Lone Tree, CO

cons: Intern year is never wonderful

job_title: Staff RN in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Great team. Love my coworkers
cons: HORRIBLE working conditions.  "If there are 2 nurses sitting down, 1 needs to go home" mentality. Unfortunately, this is a patient safety issue.  Nurses in the ER are taking 6 pts at a time sometimes regardless of acuity.  Pts are placed in chairs in the hall rather than being in the waiting room - state and HIPPA violations.  Nurses are over worked and then cut.  In 6 months, only one pay period I was not on call and worked to tears (literally) when there. Looking for another job right now.  Will never work for HCA again after I leave. Profits over patient safety should NEVER happen.

job_title: Floor Tech in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Nothing good at all about this company, If your sick you should go somewhere else because you will get sicker going there
cons:
i was in the Housekeeping department. 
Managers were outsourced, they had no clue what there were doing. I'm a very experienced cleaner told me to clean Hepatitis B on the carpet with a coffee stain remover. I was verbally abused all they got was a paper saying they shouldn't speak to employers like that. Upper management didn't do anything about it. The managers ho run it could care less about the place. And if you speak up for yourself you will be pushed out because they rather not deal with you.

job_title: Registered Nurse
pros: Very nice facility with great people to work with. Sky Ridge had two operating room centers that are excellent in what they do from Robotics to General to Orthopedics and Spine, patients say they feel good about coming here for their care and I am proud to work with an excellent team. Communication is very good and I have felt comfortable working her amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.
cons: Pay could be better but I am sure a lot of people say that about wherever they work in healthcare.

job_title: PCT/Secretary in Cleveland, TN
pros: Good Nurses, Great Doctors and thats about it
cons: ALWAYS work short handed, worked an average of 120 to 140 hours every two weeks. Staff stays in bad moods, frustrated, fed up with working conditions. Would have to shut ER down to only one section due to low staff. Pay was ok.

review_title: Not big on promoting from within for non-clinical positions
job_title: HIM Representative in Lone Tree, CO
pros:
Great company
Great mission, vision.
Seems to be a team environment
cons:
Compartmentalized a bit too much
Wasn't any growth opportunity despite work history and education
Need to promote from within and recognize next generation talent and foster that.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Great location; best job I've ever had in my 42 years as a tech.
cons: They are always short staffed due to the fact that there is a general shortage of Medical Lab Scientists nation wide.

job_title: Team Leader in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Great benefits: matching 401K, tuition reimbursement up front, employee stock purchase plan, great PTO, great management team.  Lots of opportunity for growth.
cons: Honestly, been here a long time and it is a much better work environment than other places I have worked.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Lone Tree, CO
pros: Some of the employees that work here are really nice.
cons:
Senior Leadership is VERY disconnected with employee needs. If there is a bad manager or director who is driving away staff, the Senior Leadership and HR do nothing to remedy the situation. Turn over is very high here as a result. 

Tired of seeing really good employees leave because they are afraid to discipline Managers/Directors. They are more concerned about whether they will get their yearly bonuses, than making employees happy at SRMC.

review_title: Pre Op Nurse, Quality RN, Nursing Supervisor

cons: I did not have any cons while working there
